name: cooling load
description: a rate at which sensible and latent heat must be removed from the space to maintain a constant space dry-bulb air temperature and humidity

name: LoRa
description: A wireless technology that has been developed to enable low data rate communications to be made over long distances by sensors and actuators for M2M and Internet of Things, IoT applications

name: auger dredge head
description: consists of two opposite-thread spiral cutters on a horizontal tubular body. The soil is cut by the spiral cutters, and the pitch ensures that it is carried to the center of the auger, where the suction head is situated.

name: bandwidth
description: a difference between the upper and lower frequencies in a continuous set of frequencies

name: bitstream
description: a sequential binary sequence

name: black body
description: an idealized physical body that absorbs all incident electromagnetic radiation, regardless of frequency or angle of incidence

name: closed system
description: a physical system that doesn't exchange any matter with its surroundings, and isn't subject to any net force whose source is external to the system

name: conduction
description: a transfer of heat by microscopic collisions of particles and movement of electrons within a body

name: convection
description: an algorithm that uses a series of measurements observed over time, containing statistical noise and other inaccuracies, and produces estimates of unknown variables that tend to be more precise than those based on a single measurement alone, by using Bayesian inference and estimating a joint probability distribution over the variables for each time frame

name: draghead
description: a suction mouth which is dragged across a water body

name: dredgeline
description: a pipeline which transports excavated slurry

name: electric field
description: a vector field that associates to each point in space the Coulomb force that would be experienced per unit of electric charge, by an infinitesimal test charge at that point.[1] Electric fields converge and diverge at electric charges and can be induced by time-varying magnetic fields

name: erosion
description: an action of surface processes (such as water flow or wind) that removes soil

name: graph
description: a mathematical structure used to model pairwise relations between objects. A graph in this context is made up of vertices, nodes, or points which are connected by edges, arcs, or lines

name: heating load
description: a rate at which sensible and latent heat must be added to the space to maintain a constant space dry-bulb air temperature and humidity

name: hopper
description: a storage container or compartment

name: Kalman filter
description: an algorithm that uses a series of measurements observed over time, containing statistical noise and other inaccuracies, and produces estimates of unknown variables that tend to be more precise than those based on a single measurement alone, by using Bayesian inference and estimating a joint probability distribution over the variables for each time frame

name: latent heat
description: thermal energy released or absorbed by a body

name: magnetic field
description: a magnetic effect of electric currents and magnetic materials. The magnetic field at any given point is specified by both a direction and a magnitude (or strength); as such it is a vector field

name: Maxwell's equation
description: are a set of partial differential equations that, together with the Lorentz force law, form the foundation of classical electrodynamics, classical optics, and electric circuits

name: MTIpython
description: a Python package, used within IHC, to solve engineering problems in the disciplines: fluids, thermodynamics, mechanical and electrical

name: node
description: fundamental unit of which graphs are formed

name: open system
description: a system that has external interactions. Such interactions can take the form of information, energy, or material transfers into or out of the system boundary

name: polarized plane
description: is a confinement of the electric field vector or magnetic field vector to a given plane along the direction of propagation

name: Python
description: an interpreted high-level programming language for general-purpose programming

name: radiation
description: an electromagnetic radiation generated by the thermal motion of charged particles in matter. All matter with a temperature greater than absolute zero emits thermal radiation

name: refrigerant
description: a substance or mixture, used in heat pumps to transport heat energy

name: resistor
description: a passive two-terminal electrical component that implements electrical resistance as a circuit element

name: Sankey diagram
description: a specific type of flow diagram, in which the width of the arrows is shown proportionally to the flow quantity

name: sedimentation
description: the opposite of erosion| it is  tendency for particles in suspension to settle out of the fluid in which they are entrained and come to rest against a barrier

name: silt
description: a granular material of a size between sand and clay

name: slurry
description: describe a mixture that consist of both solid and fluid phases

name: solvent
description: a substance that dissolves a solute, such as a chemically distinct liquid, solid or gas, resulting in a solution

name: tooltip
description: a popup window, containing additional information. It appears when a mouse pointer hoovers over a designated area

name: umbilical
description: a electronic cable connecting an underwater vehicle
